subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] This one speaks for itself...
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
It's spelled "urchin" and it's a term you hardly ever see used anymore. It
means "a street child" and was sometimes used as a term of affection.

I once asked "Do you want us to leave?" on an investigation and got a
response "You just got here."
:-)

Zack


On Mon, Oct 18, 2010 at 9:44 AM, Adriana Jones <adrianamjones@...>wrote:

>
>
> See endoffilewow.mp3 in my files folder. This was the very end of the
> session my husband and I did at night in Charles Town, WV cemetery, on
> October 15.
>
> Notice:
> A man whose voice persists through several seconds of the file saying...
> "you...too...erchin...wonderful" what the heck is erchin, lol! Here you
> should also notice that between "erchin" and "wonderful" there is a definite
> station change "whine" sound...
>
> Then you may also notice when I ask "Should we come back ever?" A lady
> says, "Ever?" or "Never" can tell which....
>
> We're getting some pretty convincing stuff for having been doing less than
> a month.
>
>  
>
